channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 5am noisy collection, 8th July
item.description:
Good Morning, Since October Hackney Council has been collecting bins on a tower hamlets road. For the first time in 15 years itâ€™s been before 8am. It is INCREDIBLY loud. This morning the collection was at 4:50am. This is appauling. This is not an industrial area. This is a residential street. Why Hackney Ccouncil collecting from here ? Why since Oct 24 has it been so early in the morning? Why is there multiple collections at this time THROUGHOUT the week. The recent change shows zero consideration for residence and complete lack of quality of care of which is your civic duty. Please supply me with the exact name is the depart I should write to so that local Tower Hamlets residence can make a request for change. Regards. Jean Keogh E2 9BJ 07551028429
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped tree cuttings, 8th July
item.description:
Somebody at some point has dumped a large amount of tree/push cuttings. This is a regular dumping ground for stuff within the area. Please please set up a camera and catch the people who do this as it ruins the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Lower Road, Hextable, Swanley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees cutting down, 8th July
item.description:
Can RBG explain what 4 trees were cut down on the Kidbrooke green park area? It is so bad . No shades more on hot days but the ipoint here is why cut trees in a protected area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way, Kidbrooke, London

item.title: Outside houses 5-7, 8th July
item.description:
This whole patch of road has been defective for over 2 years. You as the council have done nothing but keep it getting worse. The whole patch is at an unacceptably level and it's horrible to drive on, it's causing damage to cars, the suspension and tyres. There are cars and bicycles going into the opposite lane to drive better. Why are you letting things get this bad? You need to resurface the road and sort it out immediately.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Albert Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 13 Hartham Rd wall STILL ready to collapse despite reporting months ago, 8th July
item.description:
The wall outside 13 Hartham Road is STILL hanging at a precarious right angle being slowly leaning further out towards passers by and could collapse into public footpath at any time- injury risk to children, passers by etc. A child was recently killed in a graveyard by a falling headstone.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartham Road, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside the Queens Head and Artichoke pub, 8th July
item.description:
200 yards worth of road is not road worthy. Full of potholes. This road has been a nuisance and causing cars damage for over 1 year and nothing has been done. Get it sorted Cyclists have fallen on the horrible road surface and cars cannot go without being jolted due to the unacceptable road surface
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Albany Street, Fitzrovia, London

item.title: Illegal Poster, 8th July
item.description:
On Highland Road at the junction with Albion Road, Bexleyheath: Please remove an illegal poster advertising paving and landscaping services which has been cable-tied to a Council street sign column. Please also prosecute this prolific business owner who continues to do this around the entire Borough. Picture attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highland Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
